title: Wilfred Broadhead
text:
Wilfred Bedford Broadhead (31 May 1903 – 2 April 1986) was an English <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a>er, who played one match for <a href="Yorkshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Yorkshire County Cricket Club</a> in 1929.
Born in <a href="East%20Ardsley">East Ardsley</a>, <a href="Morley%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Morley</a>, <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>, Broadhead was a right hand batsman who scored three runs, opening with <a href="Percy%20Holmes">Percy Holmes</a> and two, batting at number 5, in his only innings for his native county against <a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent</a> in <a href="Tonbridge">Tonbridge</a>. Yorkshire lost the match by an innings. He was a right arm <a href="leg%20break">leg break</a> bowler, but did not bowl in the game.
He played at least seven games for Yorkshire Second XI in the <a href="Minor%20Counties%20Championship">Minor Counties Championship</a> in 1929 and 1930.
Broadhead died aged 82, in <a href="Wath-on-Dearne">Wath-on-Dearne</a>, in April 1986.
